website_summaries.verdict: This polyester storage cover is cheaper than the competition and works well as a dust cover.
pros: This polyester cover is a good choice for the price when you plan on storing your vehicle indoors
Measures 106 inches by 28 inches by 44.5 inches
cons: The single size may not fit larger snowmobiles
Thin cover may not hold up outside

customer_reviews.title: Thin material be sure to measure the size you need
customer_reviews.text: Thin tarp material and The Large size from EPIC will fit up to 108' and for my 2009 Ski doo GTX I needed over 140 inches so this was way off as you can see by the photo. This cover would be fine if you do not have a 2up seat but if you have a 2up OR high windshield proceed with caution. I actually cracked my mirror trying to just get over the high windshield just to the rear seat ;( Had to return it, the cover was well packaged however
customer_reviews.author: Tyler929394

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. 6 months. Ripped and destroyed. Asked amazon to help with warranty and they are unwilling. Company does not have contact info. These covers are junk and do not hold up to the outdoors. This cover was never trailered. All it did was sit outside. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Buhl

customer_reviews.title: I do like that it fits snug all the way to the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a utility cover. Not sure what else to add. I do like that it fits snug all the way to the ground so it stays in place even on the windiest days. We use it on a Honda Pioneer two seat ATV Update 9/22/15 Well, I used to like it, but we got heavy winds that caused a little rip. Well, seeing as this is not ripstop nylon, it just shredded. There's really nothing left and it's only been a few months. Not worth the cost. Might work to keep dust off in a garage as long as it doesn't get snagged on anything.
customer_reviews.author: I'm a mom

customer_reviews.title: do not bother
customer_reviews.text: the item was not what I expected. It is not the same as the picture. It immediately blew off of the snowmobile. there's nothing to anchor it to the snowmobile besides an elastic band. it is very thin. I put some rivets in it and anchor it with bungee cords, and it will do the job if its just sitting there. But I do not know how long it will last. I am guessing not very long
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy A.

customer_reviews.title: It was only $41
customer_reviews.text: Installed on Yamaha yxz stored outside, fit fine but a bit difficult to install with the elastic cord on bottom. Held up and stayed on during Az. monsoon season. 8 months have passed and now it's as tough as tissue paper .. Look at it wrong, and it will rip. I would suggest getting a new one every 6 months and you'll be fine ... About $90 per year for rain, dust and Sun protection isn't too bad I guess.
customer_reviews.author: scott r kidd

customer_reviews.title: Going in the trash before it destroys my UTV with trapped heat.
customer_reviews.text: Way way too big for 2014 Polaris RZR 570. Huge. About 20 inches too wide and 2 feet too long front to back. Swallows my UTV. Also, since it is black it works like an oven. When I took the cover off my UTV was too hotto touch, sit on or drive. Going in the trash. Also, the dimensions listed make no sense. 3.7 inches?? Really??
customer_reviews.author: J. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: This stupid thing ROCKS
customer_reviews.text: You know what? This stupid thing ROCKS! I've had straps on it going down the hwy at 65mph and without... works better with straps. I would recommend using this with straps or a tie-down of some kind. It keeps the hwy snow sludge OFF the machine.. that's what it's there for. I like the fact that it stuffs into its own little pillow too. That way I can pack it on the sled and if I get stuck and have to sleep out overnight.. I've got a pillow. :)
customer_reviews.author: DEENO

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, stays on pretty well with the wind, does not tear easily from what I can tell, keeps the snow and dirt off the sleds!
customer_reviews.author: Robert kronberg

customer_reviews.title: Only for short term or indoor
customer_reviews.text: Seems fine. Ripped itself to shreds in the wind after about a month.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality INDOOR cover.
customer_reviews.text: A good general-purpose cover really meant for indoor storage only. Those of you looking for a good outdoor cover or one for trailering, you're going to need an expensive canvas tailored for your sled.
customer_reviews.author: Frustrated Buyer

customer_reviews.title: As expected, lightweight, prevents them getting dusting and more difficult for critters to get in
customer_reviews.text: As expected- lightweight just cover our sleds in the garage with it for the non use months
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Bardsley

customer_reviews.title: Great for lightweight cover.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep the road grime that finds it way into my clamshell off of my sled to keep it clean. I used it this past off season as a dust cover, stored inside. It's excellent for what I use it for. I wouldn't recommend towing on an open trailer but it's lightweight, water resistant (I doubt 100% waterproof), and very easy to work with versus the heavy duty canvas covers. Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Fits CF Moto UForce 500
customer_reviews.text: Time will tell how durable, but I like it so far. I have a CF Moto UForce 500 model and it fits well over the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: more of a dust cover
customer_reviews.text: you get what you pay for. this cover is thin but will protect as long as your snowmobile is in a garage.
customer_reviews.author: Kirbster

customer_reviews.title: This cover is garbage. I bought two of them and after 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: This cover is garbage. I bought two of them and after 4 months of use (they were not used for towing, just outdoor storage) they are faded, have holes around where the handle bars sit and have tears around the elastic band. I would not recommend this product for out door use. It might be okay if only used indoors.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: It is very thin material and does not feel like it will last long
customer_reviews.text: It is very thin material and does not feel like it will last long. I will use it over winter and see if it holds up. I don't understand why all these makers can't use heavy duty material for that price.
customer_reviews.author: LaMar

customer_reviews.title: Nice and roomy and easy to slip on and off
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this cover. Nice and roomy and easy to slip on and off. Way larger than I needed for my children's Polaris, but it is would fit the full size so when we get one it will work great on it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ram

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Just a light-weight, packable cover that keeps light rain and dust off. Fits great and snug around the bottom to stay on in wind.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Holding up pretty good so far
customer_reviews.text: Holding up pretty good so far, cheaper than other places and fits my Can-Am Outlander on 29.5" tires with a 2" lift pretty good. Doesn't completely cover the rims but didn't expect it to!
customer_reviews.author: Reed Skin

customer_reviews.title: Material is not durable for direct sun exposure
customer_reviews.text: OK for an inside dust cover, but two months outside and it is turning gray with lots of UV damage.
customer_reviews.author: Jack White

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last the winter sitting on a sled on a trailer. It got shredded by the weather.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: Item not as pictured it's a piece of crap thinner then a garbage bag I want my money ...
customer_reviews.text: Item not as pictured it's a piece of crap thinner then a garbage bag I want my money back
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: not waterproof but great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit on Yamaha rhino with four seat conversion and extended roll cage. Covered the tires completely. Only issue, it is not waterproof.rain goes right through it. I ordered an atv cover too, same brand and it is waterproof? Good deal for the price if your storing in dry conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth D. Clark

customer_reviews.title: I sent this back didn't even try it. It ...
customer_reviews.text: I sent this back didn't even try it. It was so thin. It would work for a cover wile stored in the garage in off season to keep the dust off of it
customer_reviews.author: M W

customer_reviews.title: Epic utv cover
customer_reviews.text: Fit our atv perfectly. Large and durable. Has weathered many storms and direct sunlight without any tearing or fading. Extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Simplyglamorous

customer_reviews.title: cheap waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This cover fit well however it tore easily faded quickly . A waste of money. material is way to thin. It faded and dry rotted in less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Allen B.

customer_reviews.title: perfect for what I needed it for
customer_reviews.text: I just recently ordered this, and it fits my 2014 Honda recon perfect! We have 3 other wheelers as well, so I ordered more for all of them! The price is right :)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for fits here, too
customer_reviews.text: Don't last at all. Few rain storms, some high desert sun, and can poke holes it in just readjusting it to cover where it should be covering in the first place. Not a good cover for an atv if you need to cover for even a semi-short period of time. Buy up, get a better cover if you want it to last. Won't buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice light duty cover
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly but its pretty light duty. Best for keeping dust and sun off UTV. Does not handle windy environment real well
customer_reviews.author: Robin L Lair

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a little big
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cover my daughters power wheels car.....quality good....wish I had ordered the medium tho...little large for the Power wheels mustang.
customer_reviews.author: CdM, CA

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, has good elastic cord around bottom, which helps in windy conditions
customer_reviews.author: G in CO

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Keeps the elements out. I doubt it would last very long if being towed on an open trailer. But exactly what I wanted to keep the sun off my sled in the summer!
customer_reviews.author: A. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: an ok product!
customer_reviews.text: Never found the string to tighten the bottom of it as it shows in the package but all in all its an ok product
customer_reviews.author: JoeGamer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cover last November, less than a year ago and it didn't even last a year before it was degraded and torn by the lightest touch. I would definitely not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Speed

customer_reviews.title: Fits roofless golf carts, too!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance here, and ordered this to XL-size cover a no-roof golf cart, and it fit perfectly!! My cart is an old 1985 EZ-GO measuring approx 7' long by 42" wide. This cover fits perfectly - it seems very well-made and the shock-corded bottom covers the tires, too. It's nice and snug - the wind won't blow it off. It seems all golf cart covers assume that you have a roof to hold it up, and that's not always the case. I might have a small puddle of rain formed in the footwell on the passenger side - but that would be no problem. I am very pleased with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Masselink

customer_reviews.title: it works!
customer_reviews.text: The cover is perfect for my needs ... keeps my quad dry. Delivery was early which is always good!
customer_reviews.author: babubob

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last long in the sun before they ripped from becoming brittle.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Budge

customer_reviews.title: best one fur the price really isn't cheaply made!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap in price but successfully does the job.. not cheap in product it is sturdy and hasn't torn at all all winter! I'd buy another for sure I will buy another with the next sled!
customer_reviews.author: Nichol Marie Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my '90 Indy w/2 up seat and on ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my '90 Indy w/2 up seat and on a '95 Indy reg seat. Fits both very snug. Appears to be a good cheap storage cover.
customer_reviews.author: Katie C.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap cover but it works. We had a real bad wind storm the week I put it on and I was surprised but it stayed on.
customer_reviews.author: Mrneg9

customer_reviews.title: It fit my Yamaha Warrior very well, I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: It fit my Yamaha Warrior very well, I bought a large. It keeps the dust and pollen off. It is not very thick so it would not stop much water.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Good price and quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is hard to beat. It's a little big for the '15 RZR S 900 but I can't complain for the price, its great for some protection while storing it in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: William J Stoeck

customer_reviews.title: Great 'indoor' cover
customer_reviews.text: I should preface by admitting I live on an island in the Gulf of Alaska, so the environment can be unforgiving. I store the ATVs outside. First cover lasted a month before the wind created tear in middle. Amazon was great about replacing it. Second cover didn't tear, but the rain (admittedly often of biblical proportion here) goes right through it. So, if you're looking for a light dust cover in the garage, here's your cover. If it's going to be exposed to the elements, You might want to go heavier.
customer_reviews.author: KodiakFisherman

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for my Suzuki King Quad
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for my Suzuki King Quad. Lasted for about 6 months through NJ four seasons. I'm looking for something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: We used it to cover a queen sofa bed that ...
customer_reviews.text: We used it to cover a queen sofa bed that had to be placed outside for a few days. Fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam E. Salcedo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This fit my 2014 Ace Polaris just fine. Great for storing my machines.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap (price and quality)
customer_reviews.text: Not the highest quality. I'd expect this cover to rip within the next 12 months if it's exposed to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Barker

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Just what I want and holds up to the weather so far
customer_reviews.author: Jon Menchyk

customer_reviews.title: Sux
customer_reviews.text: Bought a large based on reviews and it barely covers the fenders. I was hoping to cover at least a little bit of the tires. Looks like a garbage bag with elastic on the bottom. That's probably why in the picture they have 1 wheel exposed - because they couldn't cover it. I have a Honda 450R so nothing huge.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for Yamaha Rhino with Cage Extension. Cover is very thin!! You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, fits nice. Bought a second and use it on my motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: chrometoyota

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: A couple of weeks of use, and the highest sun exposure area of the cover is starting to fade!!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Rostron

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good item for the money, I thought I'd be getting something cheap, but it's as good as the expensive covers.
customer_reviews.author: Photodog

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: have only had it a few months, and it's meeting all expectations. no complaints yet....
customer_reviews.author: Brad Burnham

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit well, but was a lighter weight that I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Stows away easy. No issues. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Slowboat

customer_reviews.title: Cover
customer_reviews.text: We are using it as a cover for our saw
customer_reviews.author: wyomslady

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. It was cheaper than the rest
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It was cheaper than the rest, the quality is great, and it fit my polaris just prefect.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Fits a Sportsman 400 with side mirror and a milk carton on front
customer_reviews.text: So far it has held up against several intense wind storms, although I had to use a stretch cord sideways to decrease flapping and keep it secured,. But it didn't rip or fly off. The fabric seems very thin, but well sewn. It's pretty easy to put on once you find the label stating "front." I guess time will tell how durable it will be. However, at that price I don't expect it to last more than one season, if that.
customer_reviews.author: B. MOONEY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it but thin material so It can rip easy
customer_reviews.author: Robin C. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Dust cover only not durable enough to use for trailering snowmobile. Fits Ok . Very light fabric
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: It rotted and tore A LOT within the first few months. Very very cheap cover. Was not impressed
customer_reviews.author: Landon H

customer_reviews.title: thin
customer_reviews.text: Fits great nice and snug just thin as paper and not waterproof
customer_reviews.author: Vince h

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 04 and 06 ranchers great would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Neverfast

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bought two last about 5 moths before starting to shred. Definitely not for storing outdoors
customer_reviews.author: Petr Dlabac

customer_reviews.title: I used this to cover my atv along with another ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cover my atv along with another cover together. Remember this thing is not waterproof and water will get in.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Llanes

customer_reviews.title: Not the best choice
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 4 months during which time it faded and ripped. Certainly not as high quality as I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: ojochal_steve

customer_reviews.title: This is a little smaller than expected and much lighter ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a little smaller than expected and much lighter in weight. However, it will do the job this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Great fit - love the elastic on the bottom. But, fabric seems a little light - time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Sue S.

customer_reviews.title: Fit's my thundercat with hand gards fine but fits my zr
customer_reviews.text: Fit's my thundercat with hand gards fine but fits my zr better
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Olson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly over quad and keeps it clean and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Kaufmann

customer_reviews.title: Not for winter storage outdoors.
customer_reviews.text: To light for outdoor winter use. Works fine for other seasons outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This cover is not waterproof. I put it on ...
customer_reviews.text: This cover is not waterproof. I put it on my 4-wheeler while I was camping. It rained overnight, and in the morning, I took off the cover and the 4-wheeler was completely soaked. That basically deems this cover worthless as far as I am concerned. The description says that it is weather resistant. I expected this to mean that it could withstand a little rain. That is not true at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Brian Adams

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Wast of money did not last 4 months outside and no warranty save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Klein

customer_reviews.title: John Deere cover
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install fit perfect on my john Deere 825
customer_reviews.author: james heyder

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This product is not water proof it was a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: richard w houle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fabric ATV cover
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these.An XL and a LG, one for my 2003 Sportsman 400 and a 2007 Trailboss. Both fit very well. What drew me to these is that the cover is fabric and not plastic. The plastic one I had before ripped, Its been raining a lot in Colorado and these have the rain water pool on them so I'm sure these are a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly. Was plenty large enough for our large atv
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: good light use item
customer_reviews.text: bought to keep the owl and pigeon crap off the 4 wheeler parked in the barn. Fits a large polaris with a rear basket and front gun rack perfectly. Not sure it will be a long lived item as it is pretty light weight, but for the price it servers my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: grit

customer_reviews.title: fits the can am
customer_reviews.text: this fits my 08 can am outlander 400xt with rear bag. durable cover that actually sheds water. didnt get a change to test longevity because it does not stand up to sharp little puppy claws on the side...
customer_reviews.author: greatwhite22

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect on my Raptor 350
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect on my Raptor 350, i question its waterproof ability because a few times my quad was wet inside under the cover, but maybe wind blew it under and up to the seat?
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly! Doesn't blow off or shift.. ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly! Doesn't blow off or shift..a dry and debris-free vehicle was the goal for this purchase. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Done better than expected. Even survived its first crazy wind storm.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

product_meta.title: Epic EP-7706 EX-Series Weather and UV-Resistant Snowmobile Storage Cover, Black
product_meta.description: Size:SnowmobilePure, untouched snow is the dream of every snowmobiler. Keep your machine in top form for dream rides by protecting it when not in use with an Epic EX-Series Storage Cover. It's designed for price conscious consumers demanding a great cover at an affordable price. Weather-resistant with double stitched reinforced seams and a sewn-in elastic cord are some of the features of this durable cover. Hit the trails with confidence.
feature_bullets: Protect your snowmobile when not in use from moisture, dust, weather and sun
Sewn-in elastic cord provides a custom fit
Dimensions: 106 inches x 28 inches x 44. 5 inches; Includes storage bag

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars198 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
